definition: to change/to become different/to transform/to vary/rebellion

sentences.english: A random variable is a function that takes values based on a probability distribution.
sentences.chinese: 随机变量是一个根据概率分布取值的函数。

sentences.english: Property of symmetric random variable is discussed by introducing the concept of almost supremum and infimum.
sentences.chinese: 讨论了具有倒对称随机变量的若干性质。

sentences.english: Kurtosis is a classical measure of non-Gaussianity of random variable.
sentences.chinese: 峭度是随机变量非高斯性的一个经典度量。

sentences.english: The weighted mean of the random variable is the expected value.
sentences.chinese: 随机变量的加权平均值是期望值。

sentences.english: When we observe one of these numbers, we refer to the observation as a random variable .
sentences.chinese: 当我们看到这些数字，我们指的是观察一个随机变量。

sentences.english: Meanwhile the optimization and application of radom variable is illustrated in brief.
sentences.chinese: 同时，对随机变量的优化应用亦做了扼要说明。

sentences.english: In this way, the conclution of the expectation and the square errors following the random variable is found.
sentences.chinese: 并导出了遵从这种分布的随机变量的期望与方差。

sentences.english: In mathematical terms, values that are not known with complete certainty are called random variables.
sentences.chinese: 在数学术语中，不完全确定的值称为随机变量。

sentences.english: In this article, we investigate some problems of the limit theorems of the NA random variables.
sentences.chinese: 本文研究了负相协随机变量列极限定理的若干问题。

definition: quick witted/able to think fast in an emergency
deceitful in many ways (idiom); wily and mischievous/full of craft and cunning
subtle way of thinking (idiom); hard to fathom/deep and shrewd
